fullProgramDescription: The Mathematics/Applied Science major is an interdisciplinary program that provides a foundation in mathematical and scientific principles and prepares students for a broad range of career opportunities. Students gain a strong background in mathematics, as well as knowledge in a specific area of application, such as physics, computer science, or biology. The program emphasizes the development of problem-solving skills, analytical thinking, and computational techniques.
shortProgramDescription: The Mathematics/Applied Science B.S. provides a strong foundation in mathematics and prepares students for careers in a variety of fields, including science, technology, and engineering.
classHighlights: The major requires a set of core courses in mathematics, including calculus, linear algebra, differential equations, and real analysis. These courses provide a foundation in mathematical theory and techniques.

Students also complete a series of courses in their chosen area of application, such as physics, computer science, or biology. These courses provide a deep understanding of the subject matter and its applications.

Additional coursework includes probability and statistics, numerical analysis, and computational methods. These courses provide students with the tools and techniques needed to analyze and solve problems in their chosen field.

Students also have the opportunity to take electives in a variety of areas, including mathematics, computer science, and other fields. These electives allow students to explore their interests and tailor their education to their career goals.
learningOutcomes: Develop a strong foundation in mathematical theory and techniques
Apply mathematical and scientific principles to solve problems in a variety of fields
Analyze and interpret data using statistical and computational methods
Communicate complex ideas and results effectively
Work effectively in a team environment
Pursue careers in a variety of fields, including science, technology, and engineering
additionalInformation: Students must complete a set of core courses in mathematics and a series of courses in their chosen area of application. The major requires a minimum GPA of 2.0.
